Initially we were reading the entire xml file into memory by allocating a new byte array for the amount of data available on the inputstream. Then we were passing that string into the xml parser to be parsed.

title: Updated how service is handled
message:
Updated how service is handled

Main service that the application uses is not started when the device boots. Only the auto update service is started. When the application is paused, the service is also paused except when launching an activity inside the app (Memory, Commands, Settings). The service is started when the application resumes. There are 2 exceptions: 1. if the previously mentioned activities are paused, then the service will stay running unless you quit it or return back to the main app and pause it. The service does not get stopped when the Memory, Commands or Settings activities are paused and does not get restarted from those activies. To restart the service, you must simply return to the main Status activity and all will be well. 2. If you launch the Forum or RA Website from the preferences, the service is not stopped.

title: Scroll to Status screen when entereing preferences
message:
Scroll to Status screen when entereing preferences

This is to ensure that the screen being displayed is always supposed to be there and visible.  The primary reason is if somebody changes the expansion relay quantity to a quantity less than the current quanitity, the last relay page will be displayed and will "jump" back to the previous page.
This will also benefit future improvements with additional screens and does not hurt anything to start back at the main screen once exiting the Preferences page since the user most likely changed something.
